subSections.text:
{{wp|lang=ja|カレイ}} [[file:Psetta maxima.JPG|thumb|'''鰈''' (''karei'')]]
{{ja-kanjitab|かれい|yomi=k}} {{IPAfont|/kara epi1/}} → {{IPAchar|/karepi/}} → {{IPAchar|/karefi/}} → *{{IPAchar|/karewi/}} → *{{IPAchar|/kareii/}} → {{IPAchar|/karei/}} Likely from {{inh|ja|ojp|sort=かれい|-}}. Attested in the ''Honzō Wamyō''. The ''{{w|Wamyō Ruijushō}}'' has {{l|ja||王餘魚}}, with the phonetic spellings {{m|ja||加良衣比|tr=karaepi1}} and variant {{m|ja||加禮比|tr=karepi1}}. Originally a compound of {{ja-compound|韓|^から|鱝|エイ|t1=[[Korea]]|pos1=euphemism|t2=a kind of [[ray]]|nocat=1}}. It is said that the flounder was imported from Korea to Japan in the {{w|Samhan|Samhan period}}, and was regarded to the Koreans at that time as "beautiful". The ''ei'' part is likely due to its appearance, mistaken for a "ray". {{rfv-etymology|ja}}
